"He reflects on the many years his loving mother spent in this world.
It's hard to explain the myriad hardships she endured.
It's difficult to repay the virtue of the burden I carry in October.
Three years of vegetarianism vowed to repay her kindness.
The basin of blood was transformed into a red lotus marsh.
Hell is transformed into the gate of the Pure Land.
Wealth and prosperity and glory were thus attained.
It's because of practicing filial piety that I've touched both heaven and earth.
Vow to Return the Lamp
In years past, he knelt down and promised to pray to the golden recluse.
Tonight, he rewards his benefactor by building a Dharma banquet.
A torch of wisdom burns from seven tiers of beryl.
A censer of campaka swirls with fragrant smoke.
Where the silver lantern is lit, calamities and hindrances are eliminated.
When the golden chimes are struck, it snuffs out transgressions.
It's a place where the mind is filled with perfection of effort.
The merits of his family and retinue continue to flourish.
Building a lantern and repentance stūpa
"The joyful gate of faith and goodness does its best to make it sincere.
After paying homage, he fulfills his vow with a floating image.
Ten thousand images are contained in the radiance of the relics.
A thousand bodies appear in the shadow of the true Buddha.
The Tathāgata's manifestation exalts special merit.

source_sentence: 熾盛星[火*((尤-尢+氏)/日)]建妙因。
translation: The blazing star [fire*((u-u+s)/day)] establishes a marvelous cause.
Expressed in repentance, they are completely protected by the buddhas.
Their flowers will be glorious, their fortune will be preserved for a thousand springs.
Crowds of faith confessional stūpa
"All minds turn to each other in devotion.
They sweep the streets and collect good causes.
Incense is burned on Mount Yang and the Jade Verse are burned.
The stūpa looks up to Aśoka and pays homage to the golden recluse.
Everyone's lightning sweeps away a thousand calamities.
Every door is filled with clouds, and the five blessings are complete.
From then on, the people are at peace and the country is prosperous.
The king's noble life will span ten thousand years.
Praying for Rain
"I'm sorry to hear that the tortoise's omen has broken the field.
The fires and suns burn up the sky and cut off the flow of water.
How cruel it is for a drought to strike.
It's really worrisome when the merchants and sheep stop dancing.
It's difficult to appeal to the earnest hearts of people.
We, the Buddha, should pray in compassion.
May sweet rains bless all living things.
Prosperous crops will be produced in the autumn harvest.
Pray for clear skies.
The smell of the golden censer and the jade ear is mysterious.
The faithful pray for clear skies and diligently arouse their minds.
A thousand sages gather when the Buddha's call is recited.
Where the Dharma voice vibrates, the nine heavens hear it.
The clear breeze blows away a thousand mountains of fog, and the red sun burns away ten thousand miles of clouds.
The red sun burns away ten thousand miles of clouds.
May the sage's merits inspire his response.
There'll be no more misty rain falling from obscene sources.
Scattering flowers
"This flower originally cost nothing to cultivate [plant - wood + earth].
Thank you, sweetheart, for skillfully cutting it.
The brocade embroidery is elegant in a thousand ways.
The five colors of the ornamentation are cut off from the dust.
Their appearance doesn't rely on the power of sunlight and harmony.
I'd rather worry about the destruction of wind and rain when I embellish it.
I present it to the Buddha in praise of his goodness.
May I pray for blessings and fortune to come with each passing day.
To untie the bonds
The Sanskrit sound is clear and penetrating, the sound of the ocean's tide.
It circles the silver lantern deep into the midnight hours.
Seven times seven, the vow to cast off merit has been fulfilled.
The three times he's freed from the bonds of sin and sunken into obscurity.
Sounding together, they'll enter the true path.
Each moment is always without turning away from his mind.
Blessed are the faithful who depart from here.
The vast ocean of merit rises a thousand fathoms.
Repentance for Killing Life
"My life is a vagrant existence in a cage.
There's no limit to the number of grievances that can be formed.
I pray to the spirits for the power of good fortune.
He invites guests to show off his family's style.
Feathers are chopped on a chopping block, and knives are chopped on an anvil.
Scales are cooked in a cannon and a cauldron.
Crowds of believers burn lamps to extend repentance.
One moment, they transcend and step into the heavenly palace.
Raising a banner...
The five banners of the spirits stand in the sky.
It invites faith in the supernormal powers and hopes to inspire understanding.
A colorful phoenix rises from the top of a hundred-foot pole.
Flying dragons appear in the nine heavenly clouds.
It beckons the six destinies to return to their true limit.
He guides the three destinies into the true teaching.
At the eleventh and twelve hours, he extends the summons.
The noble sages vow to descend on the Dharma seat.
Releasing Life
"The feather-scaled, pure precepts have been circumscribed.
He's broken through the darkness of karma amid the sound of the Dharma and music.
The birds head for the blue sky to become phoenixes that depart.
The fish swim in the deep water and turn into dragons that run.
Their feathers are brushed together as they return to the Dan cave.
Their horns gently shake as they penetrate Umen.
From this point on, the Buddha's merits are nurtured by transformation.
In other times, merit will reward faithful people for their kindness.

source_sentence: 高峰龍泉院因師集賢語錄卷之五
translation: Gopeng Longquanyuan Yuan Inshi Jixian yulu, vol. 5
